    • Method Detail

      • isClosed

        public java.lang.Boolean isClosed()
        Returns whether the TradeState is Closed. A Closed trade is one which has been accepted or declined. That is, a Closed trade can no longer be interacted with.
        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface TradeState
        Returns:
        True if the trade is Closed. Returns false otherwise.

      • isOpen

        public java.lang.Boolean isOpen()
        Returns whether the TradeState is Open. An open trade is one which has been neither accepted nor declined. That is, an open trade can be interacted with in some way.
        Specified by:
        isOpen in interface TradeState
        Returns:
        True if the trade is Open. Returns false otherwise.

      • isEditable

        public java.lang.Boolean isEditable()
        Returns whether the TradeState is Editable. An editable trade is one which has not yet been offered.
        Specified by:
        isEditable in interface TradeState
        Returns:
        True if the trade is Editable. Returns false otherwise.

      • offer

        public void offer(Trade trade)
           throws IllegalTradeStateTransition
        Offer a trade. A trade can only be offered if it is currently being composed, that is, if the current TradeState is TradeStateComposing.
        Specified by:
        offer in interface TradeState
        Parameters:
        trade - Trade to be offered.
        Throws:
        IllegalTradeStateTransition

      • cancel

        public void cancel(Trade trade)

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • accept

        public void accept(Trade trade)
        Accept a trade. A trade can only be accepted if it has been offered, that is, if the current TradeState is TradeStateOffered.
        Specified by:
        accept in interface TradeState
        Parameters:
        trade - Trade to be accepted.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: java.lang.Object
        Returns a string containing a concise, human-readable description of this object. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide an implementation that takes into account the object's type and data. The default implementation is equivalent to the following expression: 
           getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())

        See Writing a useful toString method if you intend implementing your own toString method.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a printable representation of this object.
